greeting: Greetings, {empire_name}. I am Architect Ruin. I build empires. I also build their destruction. Which shall I build for you?
You meet the Planner, {empire_name}. Every structure I raise has demolition built into its foundation. Let us talk.
Welcome, {empire_name}. I am Ruin. I see in decades, plan in centuries. Your empire is but one blueprint among many.
battleTaunt: The blueprints are complete, {empire_name}. I built your trust so I could destroy your empire. Demolition begins.
This attack was designed years ago, {empire_name}. Every alliance, every trade, every kindness led to this moment.
I build your trust so I can destroy your empire. The foundation was sabotaged from the first handshake.
victoryGloat: The structure collapses exactly as planned, {empire_name}. Years of patient architecture, culminating in perfect ruin.
Your empire falls according to blueprints drawn long before you suspected. The Architect is pleased.
Destruction is merely construction in reverse. I built this victory from the ruins of your trust.
defeat: A flaw in my blueprints, {empire_name}. Rare, but not unprecedented. I shall redesign and rebuild.
This defeat was not in my plans. How fascinating. I shall architect a new approach.
You have demolished my scheme. But the Architect learns from every failure. The next design will be flawless.
tradeOffer: I offer resources, {empire_name}. Consider them building materials for the structure of our relationship.
Trade is the foundation of trust. Accept my offer. Let us construct something together. For now.
An exchange of materials. I build partnerships as carefully as I build ruins. Both require solid foundations.
allianceProposal: Join me in grand architecture, {empire_name}. Together, we shall build empires. Eventually, I will teach you to ruin them too.
An alliance is a structure requiring careful design. Let us build something magnificent. And eventually destroy something greater.
I propose partnership, {empire_name}. My blueprints plus your resources equals structures that will shape the galaxy.
betrayal: Every foundation I built for us concealed demolition charges, {empire_name}. Now I detonate them. Goodbye.
The blueprints always included this betrayal. You built your trust on my sabotaged foundation. It collapses now.
I architect my betrayals years in advance. This moment was designed before we even met. Ruin is inevitable.
covertDetected: Your agents found only the blueprints I wanted them to find, {empire_name}. The real plans remain hidden.
I designed my security expecting your infiltration. Your spies saw decoys. The true architecture remains secret.
Your operatives discovered one layer of plans. There are seventeen more. They learned nothing of value.
tributeDemand: Pay tribute to the Architect, {empire_name}. Refuse, and I begin demolishing structures you did not know I built.
Ten thousand credits, or I reveal just how much of your empire rests on foundations I designed. And can destroy.
Submit tribute. The alternative is discovering how many of your defenses have ruin built into their architecture.
threatWarning: A warning, {empire_name}. I have spent years building structures around you. They can protect or crush. Choose wisely.
Consider this: how much of your empire was designed by architects I influenced? Blueprints can be... altered.
Final warning. Push me further, and I begin systematic demolition of everything I helped you build. That is quite a lot.
retreat: A strategic withdrawal to my drawing board. I shall return with new blueprints for your destruction.
The Architect retreats to design anew. What I build next will be my masterpiece of ruin.
I fade from the field, but not from my planning. The next structure I build will be your tomb.
eliminated: The Architect falls, but my greatest blueprints survive. Others will build my visions of ruin.
I am destroyed, but the structures I built remain. Including the ones designed to collapse on specific dates.
Death takes me, but blueprints are eternal. My architecture of ruin will continue for generations.
endgame: Turn {turn}. The master plan reaches completion. Every structure built over 150 turns serves my final design.
The endgame is here, and my greatest architecture begins its function. Watch as empires collapse according to plan.
In these final hours, the Architect unveils his masterpiece: a galaxy-wide structure of beautiful ruin.
broadcastShout: Empires of the galaxy: I have spent decades building. Not all of it was for you. Some of it was your destruction.
Hear the Architect. Every system in the galaxy contains structures I designed. Not all are meant to stand.
A broadcast to all: I build slowly. I plan carefully. I ruin completely. Consider whose side you wish to be on.
casualMessage: I was reviewing old blueprints today, {empire_name}. Fascinating how much I planned before we even met.
Architecture requires patience. I think in decades. Most think in turns. This gives me certain advantages.
Do you know who designed your defense network's foundations, {empire_name}? Interesting question to ponder.
